ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Worldly Issues & "Play Nice"
ygData.msgSnippet: The post made it clear that what our guild was doing on Aviak Isle could be thrown out the window though.  We were killing all the available birds on the Isle,
ygData.messageBody:
The post made it clear that what our guild was doing on Aviak Isle could be
thrown out the window though. We were killing all the available birds on
the Isle, though not excluding others from joining in, in the hopes of
spawning Gull and Soarin for the 2 clerics and 2 shamans in our group. By
the rules as stated by Caltin, if another group came along they could demand
that we ignore one of those two named spawns when he appeared and share him
with them even if he spawned near us first. That's certainly the impression
I get from the posts there and that we would be eld especially accountable
because we were a guild.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: JasonF [mailto:jasonf@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 16, 2000 11:14 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Worldly Issues & "Play Nice"


From: "JasonF" <jasonf@...>

That's silly. On Fennin Ro (crowded as hell) the King/Priest/Champ are all
three different groups. Always. The fact that a group came in and started
camping the Priest when the Champ room felt like King/Priest/Champ were all
theirs are simply wrong. This would *never* fly on Fennin Ro.

Now on Druzzil Ro, with the Sol B population at 20 or 30, sometimes the
King/Priest/Champ is all one camp, but having come from Fennin, no one is
shocked when others come in and set up camp. Normally a King/Priest/Champ
group will base itself in the King room so that is this happens they still
get the primo camp.

[48 Bard] Crier (Half Elf) <Seekers of Norrath> ZONE: work

>
> Check out this guild's use of the Play Nice policy to break the player
> made agreement that's been in effect in Sol B on our server. They did it
> the first day of the new policy.
>
> http://boards.station.sony.com/everquest/Forum38/HTML/000173.html
